db_record.REQUESTJSON: {"kibana.alert.rule.name": "Abnormally Large DNS Response", "@timestamp": "2025-10-05T16:56:50.469Z", "destination": {"port": 53, "ip": "8.8.8.8"}, "rule": {"name": "Lan_Wan"}, "source": {"port": 55583, "ip": "192.168.0.12"}, "ip_list": "\"192.168.0.1\"", "network": {"protocol": "dns"}, "event.action": "accept", "event.category": ["network"], "event.outcome": "success", "kibana.alert.workflow_status": "open", "kibana.alert.reason": "network event with source 192.168.0.12:55583, destination 8.8.8.8:53, created medium alert Abnormally Large DNS Response.", "kibana.alert.severity": "medium", "kibana.alert.rule.description": "Specially crafted DNS requests can manipulate a known overflow vulnerability in some Windows DNS servers, resulting in Remote Code Execution (RCE) or a Denial of Service (DoS) from crashing the service.", "_id": "6d34d75059d76f134bdb7db4cdb806951dd40e2f0cf3870def8f348a073269ff", "_relevance_score": 9.0}

original_alert_details.kibana.alert.rule.name: Abnormally Large DNS Response
original_alert_details.kibana.alert.reason: network event with source 192.168.0.12:55583, destination 8.8.8.8:53, created medium alert Abnormally Large DNS Response.
original_alert_details.kibana.alert.rule.description: Specially crafted DNS requests can manipulate a known overflow vulnerability in some Windows DNS servers, resulting in Remote Code Execution (RCE) or a Denial of Service (DoS) from crashing the service.
